skill.name: claude-reflect
skill.description: Self-learning system that captures corrections during sessions and reminds users to run /reflect to update CLAUDE.md. Use when discussing learnings, corrections, or when the user mentions remembering something for future sessions.
skill.summary: Self-learning system that captures corrections during sessions and reminds users to run /reflect to ...
skill.author: BayramAnnakov

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate self-learning system with no malicious intent. All static findings are false positives: shell commands are documentation examples, hidden file access targets the standard ~/.claude/ directory for Claude configuration, and credential references are guidance documentation, not actual access. The critical heuristic alert incorrectly flagged local file operations as dangerous.

content.user_title: Capture corrections to remember in CLAUDE.md
content.value_statement: Users often correct Claude Code during sessions but lose those learnings between sessions. This skill automatically detects corrections, queues them, and helps you apply them to CLAUDE.md so Claude remembers your preferences in future sessions.
actual_capabilities: Detects correction patterns during sessions using regex and semantic analysis
Queues learnings to ~/.claude/learnings-queue.json for later review
Scans past sessions with --scan-history to find missed corrections
Applies approved learnings to CLAUDE.md and AGENTS.md with human review
Supports global (all projects) and project-specific learning scopes
limitations: Requires human review - learnings are never auto-applied without approval
Cannot capture non-verbal corrections or contextual feedback
First-time use requires --scan-history to discover past session learnings

use_cases.title: Remember model preferences
use_cases.description: Capture corrections like 'use gpt-5.1 not gpt-5' so Claude remembers your model preferences across sessions.

use_cases.title: Build project conventions
use_cases.description: Store project-specific coding standards and tool preferences that apply to everyone using the shared CLAUDE.md.

use_cases.title: Create persistent memory
use_cases.description: Build a comprehensive memory of your workflow preferences that persists between Claude Code sessions.

prompt_templates.title: Process queued learnings
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /reflect to process my queued learnings from this session.

prompt_templates.title: Find past corrections
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /reflect --scan-history to find corrections I made in past sessions.

prompt_templates.title: Review before applying
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /reflect --review to see my queued learnings with confidence scores before processing.

prompt_templates.title: Consolidate duplicates
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /reflect --dedupe to find and consolidate similar entries in my CLAUDE.md files.

output_examples.input: User says: no, use gpt-5.1 not gpt-5 for reasoning
output: Hook queues learning: Use gpt-5.1 for reasoning tasks
Scans all past session files for corrections
Finds 5 learnings missed by real-time hooks
User reviews and applies 3 to CLAUDE.md
User can skip low-confidence entries before applying

best_practices: Use 'remember:' prefix for important corrections to ensure high-confidence capture
Run /reflect after git commits to capture work-related learnings
Review and edit learnings before applying to ensure clarity and accuracy
anti_patterns: Skipping /reflect regularly causes corrections to be lost between sessions
Applying learnings without review allows low-confidence noise into CLAUDE.md
Forgetting --scan-history on new machines loses learnings from past sessions

faq.question: Does this send my data externally?
faq.answer: No. All processing happens locally on your machine using your Claude configuration files only.

faq.question: Can I remove a learning after applying it?
faq.answer: Yes. Edit ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md or project CLAUDE.md directly to remove or modify entries.

faq.question: Does it work with other AI tools?
faq.answer: Yes. It syncs to AGENTS.md which works with Codex, Cursor, Aider, Jules, Zed, and Factory.

faq.question: What happens to my queue if I don't run /reflect?
faq.answer: Learnings stay queued until you run /reflect. They are flagged as stale after 90 days of decay.

faq.question: Can I use this without internet?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill uses local file operations and optional Claude CLI for semantic analysis.

faq.question: Is my data secure?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads your Claude session files and writes to your CLAUDE.md files.
